page.title: 15Charity Work
page.content:
Darland School, Rossett, is fully involved in local charity work. Since opening in 1958, the school has supported the Leprosy Mission. The school and community support the Gladys Aylward Childrens' Trust and Christian Aid. Year long appeals have been run for the Tear Fund, Oxfam for Ethiopia, R.N.I.B., Cystic Fibrosis charity and Save the Children.
At Harvest Festival time first and second year pupils bring produce which is distributed to the senior citizens of the area. Senior pupils bring donations for charity.
At Christmas time a concert and tea are given for the residents of Trevalyn Hospital. A Carol Service is held in Rossett Church with a collection for Trevalyn Hospital.
